This model doesn’t receive as frequent discounts as its Goat O1000 and A2500 models, though we have seen it dropping between $2,600 and $2,500 most of the year, with more recent falls as low as $2,100 and a one-time Prime Day low of $2,085. You’re looking at the second-best price here while the savings stick around, giving you the most advanced robot mower from the brand’s lineup with $900 savings. You can also save more by going with the base Goat O1000 robot that is down at new $699 low right now for Christmas – with both models arriving before the upcoming holiday.

items.title: Jackery Xmas flash sale up to $1,700 off power stations: First deal on Explorer 300D 40W solar bundle at $249, more

As part of its ongoing Christmas Holiday Sale, Jackery has launched a 72-hour flash sale with up to $1,700 savings across four particular units, dropping most of them to new and returning low prices, while also offering the first-ever deal on the latest Explorer 300D Portable Power Station with a 40W Air solar panel for $249 shipped. You can also find the standalone station for $169 shipped. The station recently snuck onto the scene with little media attention and normally goes for $219 at full price, while the flash-featured bundle goes for $359. This is the very first savings that we have noticed on this compact unit, which is nowhere to be found on Amazon. All-in-all, you’re getting a $50 markdown on the station and $110 off the bundle, which sets the bar for future discounts down the road. Head below to check out all the other 72-hour low prices while they’re still around!

items.summary:
Ivan Mehta / TechCrunch:
Google makes Gemini 3 Flash the default model in the Gemini app and Search's AI mode; it scored 33.7% without tool use on Humanity's Last Exam vs. 3 Pro's 37.5%  —  Google today released its fast and cheap Gemini 3 Flash model, based on the Gemini 3 released last month, looking to steal OpenAI's thunder.

items.title: Google sues the Chinese-speaking cybercriminal group known as Darcula, allegedly behind a US text message phishing ring, in the US, seeking a restraining order (Kevin Collier/NBC News)
items.summary:
Kevin Collier / NBC News:
Google sues the Chinese-speaking cybercriminal group known as Darcula, allegedly behind a US text message phishing ring, in the US, seeking a restraining order  —  Google says the group's tools enabled scammers with little technical skill to impersonate agencies like the IRS and the USPS at a massive scale.
